author: Minifig290
title: New Prints & Great Build!!
review:
Hello all, today i’ll be looking at arguably the best BrickHeadz character to date, and obviously that’s Minnie Mouse that was released in August 2018 for £/$9.99 containing 129 parts giving a price per part of 7p. Minnie was released alongside her iconic fellow mouse Mickey.

Lets look at this awesome, cute and awesome display piece.

Build

Minnie uses 124 of the parts to a great advantage. Starting from her iconic bow, the bow is built using two inverted slopes in red printed with 5 spots each attached onto a 1x1 brick with studs on all sides to connect it together with some 1x1 red tiles. Her head is nearly identical to that of Mickeys with two dishes in a black colour for each ear that are connected from a clip that’s indebted into her heads build. The back of her head is flat and pretty much the same of the sides but with a bit of tan that isn’t continued from the face. Speaking of her face, her noise is a simple black stud on a tan jumper plate that is slightly sticking out by half a plates height. Minnie’s eyes are the usual Brickheadz printed 1x1 round plate eyes. Above her eyes there is a exclusive eyebrow print on a 1x4 tan tile then 4 quarter tiles that round of her head perfectly.

Now her body build is similar to some of the 70 odd other Brickheadz. Using some of the 1x2x1and3/4 bricks with four studs on one side to hold her arms. There are a total of 7 new prints for her pock-a-dot dress, two 1x4 red bricks, 4 corner slopes in red and a 2x2 slope in red. These prints bring excellent detail. At the back, a black whip piece is used for her tail that is inserted into a black technic pin in the simple build.

Her legs are just one plate thick as Minnie’s yellow shoes are built, these shoes are the biggest i’ve seen for a Brickheadz characte. Due to the size of her shoes a new type of base is used using a 6x6 black plate with a 2x4 and 1x2 tile but has two 1x2 black jumpers. Sadly no printed plaque which stopped earlier this year with wave 2.

______________________________

Overall

To conclude my reveiw of then iconic mouse, i’d definitely say to anybody to get the Minnie and Mickey Brickheadz. I’d say this as Minnie is well built and detailed. Also i love the many prints used throughout the build with a whopping 11 prints overall.

Pros- Great prints, well detailed and designed, fun to build, easily recognisable

Cons- None to mention

(Also these are currently LEGO exclusives, so a LEGOLAND, LEGO Store and LEGO Shop at home all should have this)
